definitions: material used as covering or protection for surfaces, especially during construction
fabric woven to make sheets for beds and similar household uses
examples: Workers covered the furniture with plastic sheeting before painting
The construction site used heavy-duty sheeting to protect against weather
She bought cotton sheeting to make new bed sheets herself
The hotel uses high thread count sheeting for their luxury suites

definitions: Arab chief or head of a family, tribe, or village
romantically attractive man, especially one with exotic or mysterious qualities
examples: The sheik welcomed the travelers to his desert encampment
Local sheiks gathered to discuss matters affecting their tribes
He dressed as a desert sheik for the costume party
Silent film stars often played mysterious sheiks in romantic dramas

definitions: religious leader or scholar in Islamic communities
head of an Arab family, tribe, or governmental subdivision
examples: The sheikh delivered Friday prayers at the mosque
Students studied Islamic law under the guidance of respected sheikhs
The sheikh ruled over several villages in the region
Oil-rich sheikhs invested heavily in international real estate

definitions: basic monetary unit of Israel, divided into one hundred agorot
ancient Hebrew unit of weight and currency mentioned in biblical texts
examples: The souvenir cost fifty shekels at the Jerusalem market
Exchange rates showed the shekel strengthening against the dollar
Biblical texts mention thirty shekels of silver as payment
Ancient merchants weighed gold using the shekel standard

definitions: flat horizontal surface fixed to a wall or frame for holding objects
underwater ledge of rock or coral near the shore
examples: She arranged the books alphabetically on the shelf
The medicine cabinet had three glass shelves inside
Divers explored the continental shelf for marine life
The coral shelf extended hundreds of meters from the island

definitions: hard protective outer case of mollusks, eggs, nuts, or seeds
explosive artillery projectile fired from large guns
outer structure or framework of something, especially a building
command-line interface program that interprets user commands
examples: She collected colorful shells along the beach
The turtle retreated into its protective shell
Artillery shells exploded near the enemy positions
The museum displayed shells from World War Two
The building was just a shell after the fire
They bought the shell of an old barn to renovate
Programmers often prefer working in a Unix shell
The bash shell provides powerful scripting capabilities

definitions: purified lac resin dissolved in alcohol used as wood finish
hard protective coating or varnish made from this substance
examples: The antique furniture gleamed with multiple coats of shellac
Craftsmen applied shellac to seal the wood grain
Old phonograph records were made using shellac compounds
The floor had a thick shellac coating for protection

definitions: bombardment by explosive shells from artillery weapons
examples: The troops took cover from the intense shellfire
Continuous shellfire destroyed most of the buildings
Survivors described the terrifying sound of incoming shellfire
The bunker provided protection against enemy shellfire

definitions: aquatic animals with shells, especially edible mollusks and crustaceans
examples: The restaurant specializes in fresh shellfish and seafood
People with shellfish allergies must avoid shrimp and lobster
Oyster farms cultivate shellfish in coastal waters
The shellfish harvest was excellent this season

definitions: bombardment with explosive shells from artillery or mortars
process of removing shells or outer coverings from nuts, peas, or similar items
examples: The city endured heavy shelling for three days
Civilians fled the area to escape the shelling
Grandma spent the afternoon shelling peas for dinner
The factory uses machines for shelling pecans

definitions: structure that provides protection from weather or danger
institution providing temporary accommodation for homeless or abused people
examples: Hikers found shelter in a cave during the storm
The bus shelter protected commuters from the rain
The animal shelter houses abandoned dogs and cats
Volunteers served meals at the homeless shelter

definitions: person who tends and guards sheep in pastures
religious leader who guides and cares for a congregation
examples: The shepherd led his flock to fresh pastures
Australian shepherds helped manage vast sheep stations
The pastor served as a shepherd to his congregation
She was a gentle shepherd guiding troubled youth

definitions: frozen dessert made from fruit juice, sugar, and water or milk
sweet effervescent powder eaten as candy or dissolved in water
examples: She ordered raspberry sherbet for dessert
The sherbet was lighter than ice cream but still refreshing
Children enjoyed the fizzy sherbet that tingled on their tongues
British sweet shops sold sherbet fountains as treats

definitions: elected chief law enforcement officer of a county in the United States
ceremonial officer in English counties
examples: The sheriff's department investigated crimes throughout the county
Voters elected a new sheriff who promised reform
The High Sheriff presided over ceremonial county functions
Medieval sheriffs collected taxes for the crown

definitions: informal term for a detective or investigator
person who demonstrates exceptional deductive reasoning skills
examples: Nice work, sherlock, you solved the mystery
Every amateur sherlock tried to crack the case
Don't need to be a sherlock to figure that out
She's the office sherlock when things go missing

definitions: fortified wine from white grapes grown near Jerez, Spain
examples: She served dry sherry before dinner as an aperitif
The recipe called for a splash of cooking sherry
Sweet sherry pairs well with desserts and cheese
British traditions often include sherry at Christmas

definitions: broad piece of armor carried for protection against weapons
distinctive emblem or coat of arms displayed on a shield shape
examples: Medieval knights carried shields into battle
The riot police advanced behind their plastic shields
The family shield displayed three golden lions
Each house at the school had its own shield design

definitions: material or structure that blocks radiation, electromagnetic fields, or other harmful elements
action of protecting someone or something from harm or exposure
examples: Lead shielding protects workers from X-ray exposure
The spacecraft needed special shielding against cosmic radiation
Parents were shielding their children from disturbing news
The thick walls provided shielding from the noise

definitions: scheduled period of work time, especially in factories or hospitals
change in position, direction, or focus
gear position in a vehicle transmission
loose-fitting straight dress or undergarment
examples: She works the night shift at the hospital
Factory workers changed at the end of their shift
There's been a shift in public opinion recently
The tectonic shift caused the earthquake
He forgot to shift into reverse before backing up
The car wouldn't shift out of second gear
She wore a simple cotton shift to stay cool
The medieval shift served as an undergarment

definitions: mechanism for changing gears in a vehicle or bicycle
person who moves or changes things, especially a worker who changes shifts
examples: The bike's shifter needed adjustment for smooth gear changes
She preferred the paddle shifters to a traditional stick
The factory employed shifters to move heavy equipment
Night shifters arrived as day workers left

definitions: action of moving or changing position gradually
process of changing from one state, form, or level to another
examples: The shifting sands made walking difficult
Constant shifting of cargo destabilized the ship
The shifting political landscape worried investors
Cultural shifting happens slowly over generations

definitions: former British monetary unit equal to twelve pence
basic monetary unit in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and Somalia
examples: Victorian prices were often listed in shillings and pence
He found an old shilling coin in his grandfather's collection
The safari cost five thousand Kenyan shillings per person
Exchange booths converted dollars to Ugandan shillings

definitions: thin wedge or piece of material used to fill gaps or level surfaces
examples: The carpenter inserted wooden shims to level the door frame
Metal shims adjusted the machinery alignment perfectly
They used plastic shims under the washing machine
Precision shims ensured proper bearing clearance

definitions: soft wavering light that seems to move slightly
examples: Moonlight created a shimmer on the lake surface
The heat shimmer distorted the distant mountains
Her dress had a beautiful pearl shimmer
Stars cast their shimmer through the clear night

definitions: abnormal vibration or wobbling motion, especially in a vehicle
jazz dance characterized by rapid shaking of the body
examples: The car developed a dangerous shimmy at high speeds
Front wheel shimmy indicated alignment problems
She performed the shimmy dance at the jazz club
1920s flappers popularized the shimmy

definitions: front part of the leg between knee and ankle
bone in the front of the lower leg, the tibia
examples: He bruised his shin on the coffee table
Soccer players often wear guards to protect their shins
The X-ray showed a hairline fracture in her shin
Athletes sometimes develop painful shin splints

definitions: quality of brightness from reflected light or polished surface
outstanding quality or performance that attracts attention
examples: The shoe shine made his boots look brand new
Morning sunshine gave everything a golden shine
She really had her moment to shine at the concert
The young athlete's shine caught scouts' attention

definitions: bruise around the eye causing dark discoloration
small silvery freshwater fish of the minnow family
examples: He got a shiner from the boxing match
Her shiner took weeks to heal completely
Fishermen used shiners as bait for larger fish
The pond was full of golden shiners

definitions: thin rectangular tile used to cover roofs and walls
mass of small rounded pebbles on a seashore
small signboard displaying a professional's name and services
examples: Storm winds tore several shingles from the roof
Cedar shingles weather to an attractive gray color
Waves crashed against the shingle beach noisily
Walking on shingle beaches requires sturdy shoes
The lawyer hung out her shingle on Main Street
Doctors' shingles lined the medical building entrance

definitions: quality of emitting or reflecting bright light
state of being outstandingly good or successful
examples: The shining of stars filled the desert sky
Her hair had a healthy shining appearance
This was his shining moment of achievement
The shining example inspired other students

definitions: large boat for transporting people or goods by sea
large spacecraft for interplanetary or interstellar travel
examples: The cruise ship carried three thousand passengers
Container ships transport goods across oceans
The colony ship traveled to Mars for six months
Science fiction often features faster-than-light ships

definitions: company or person that designs and constructs ships
examples: The shipbuilder won contracts for three naval vessels
Korean shipbuilders dominate the global market
His grandfather worked as a shipbuilder in Glasgow
Modern shipbuilders use computer-aided design

definitions: design and construction of ships as an industry or process
examples: Shipbuilding provides thousands of jobs in the coastal region
Advanced shipbuilding techniques reduce construction time
The city's shipbuilding heritage spans three centuries
Modern shipbuilding uses modular assembly methods

definitions: quantity of goods sent together as cargo or freight
examples: The shipment arrived two days ahead of schedule
International shipments require customs documentation
They tracked the shipment across three countries
The damaged shipment was returned to sender

definitions: person or company that owns one or more merchant ships
examples: Greek shipowners control a large portion of global tonnage
The shipowner invested in eco-friendly vessels
Insurance costs worried small shipowners
Shipowners met to discuss new maritime regulations

definitions: person or company that sends or transports goods
examples: The shipper guaranteed next-day delivery
Online retailers work with multiple shippers
International shippers must comply with export regulations
The shipper provided tracking information

definitions: transport of goods by sea or other means
charge for delivering goods to a customer
examples: Global shipping moves ninety percent of traded goods
The shipping industry adopted cleaner fuels
Free shipping on orders over fifty dollars
Calculate shipping based on weight and distance

definitions: destruction or sinking of a ship at sea
remains of a ship that has been wrecked
examples: The storm caused a tragic shipwreck off the coast
Survivors of the shipwreck waited days for rescue
Divers explored the ancient shipwreck for artifacts
The shipwreck became an artificial reef

definitions: skilled carpenter who builds and repairs wooden ships
examples: The shipwright restored the historic sailing vessel
Traditional shipwrights pass skills through apprenticeships
Museum shipwrights demonstrate historical building techniques
The shipwright shaped oak timbers for the hull

definitions: place where ships are built, maintained, and repaired
examples: The naval shipyard employed thousands of workers
Modern shipyards use massive cranes and dry docks
The historic shipyard now serves as a museum
Ships enter the shipyard for annual maintenance

definitions: rural area forming an administrative district, especially in Britain
large powerful breed of draft horse originating in Britain
examples: The Yorkshire shire encompasses diverse landscapes
Local government reorganized the traditional shires
The shire horse pulled heavy brewery wagons
Shire horses stand over seventeen hands high

definitions: garment for the upper body with collar, sleeves, and front opening
examples: He ironed his white shirt for the interview
The school uniform included a blue shirt
She wore a flannel shirt on the camping trip
Designer shirts filled the boutique displays

definitions: solid waste matter discharged from the bowels
something considered worthless, untrue, or of extremely poor quality
unpleasant or difficult situation or experience
examples: The dog left shit on the sidewalk again
Bird shit covered the car windshield
Don't believe his shit about being rich
This old computer is complete shit
We're in deep shit if they find out
She's been through some serious shit lately

definitions: sharp weapon made from available materials, especially in prison
examples: Guards found a shiv hidden in the cell
He fashioned a shiv from a toothbrush handle
The prisoner threatened others with a makeshift shiv
Metal detectors help prevent shivs in facilities

definitions: seven-day Jewish mourning period for close relatives
one of the principal deities of Hinduism, known as the destroyer
examples: The family sat shiva for their grandmother
Friends brought food during the shiva period
Devotees offered prayers to Lord Shiva
The temple featured a statue of Shiva dancing

definitions: trembling motion from cold, fear, or excitement
small fragment or splinter of something broken
examples: A shiver ran down her spine in the haunted house
His shiver revealed how cold he was
The mirror broke into a thousand shivers
A shiver of glass cut his finger

definitions: continuous shaking movement typically from cold or fear
examples: His uncontrollable shivering worried the rescue team
The shivering stopped once she warmed up
Fear left her shivering despite the warm weather
The dog's shivering indicated severe stress

definitions: shallow place in water where navigation is dangerous
large group of fish swimming together
examples: The ship ran aground on an underwater shoal
Charts marked dangerous shoals near the harbor
A shoal of mackerel attracted the dolphins
Fishermen spotted huge shoals moving north

definitions: sudden emotional disturbance causing surprise or dismay
life-threatening medical condition from severe injury or trauma
violent impact or collision between objects
sudden discharge of electricity through the body
examples: The news of her death came as a terrible shock
He stood in shock after witnessing the accident
Paramedics treated the patient for hemorrhagic shock
The trauma victim went into shock
The shock of the collision damaged both vehicles
Earthquake shocks continued throughout the night
She got an electric shock from the faulty outlet
Static shock surprised him when he touched the doorknob

definitions: event or piece of news that causes great surprise or dismay
person or thing that shocks or appalls others
examples: The election results were a real shocker
Her resignation came as a shocker to everyone
That horror movie was an absolute shocker
His rude behavior made him a shocker at parties
